headline: Erik ten Hag handed boost in bid to offload second Man Utd star after Scott McTominay blow
body: Manchester United are expected to be busy ahead of next week's transfer deadline and Hannibal Mejbri could be the latest player to depart Old Trafford amid interest from the Championship
Burnley want Manchester United ’s Hannibal Mejbri to replace Fulham -bound Sander Berge.

Fulham have agreed to pay £20million, rising to £25m, for Norway midfielder Berge, having previously targeted United midfielder Scott McTominay - but they were unable to reach an agreement. Now the Clarets are targeting Mejbri as Berge’s replacement.

Mejbri, 21, played in United’s win at Turf Moor last September and is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford, having entered the final year of his contract. United would prefer a cash deal for the Tunisia midfielder, who made just six appearances during an all-fated loan spell at Sevilla.
Burnley are also signing Chelsea centre-back Bashir Humphreys, who enjoyed a successful loan spell at Swansea last season.
Humphreys has had his medical at Burnley and the 21-year-old will strengthen their defensive options with Republic of Ireland international Dara O’Shea being targeted by Wolves and Brentford.

Wolves want O’Shea to replace Max Kilman, who has joined West Ham for £40million, and the Clarets want £15million for him after paying his £7million release clause at West Brom last summer. Brentford are also keen and Burnley are determined he will only leave if their asking price is met.

United, meanwhile, also remain in the hunt for Paris St Germain’s Uruguay midfielder Manuel Ugarte. They will not pay PSG ’s £51million asking price for Ugarte and the French club may lower their demands as the end of the window looms into view.

Ugarte, 23, was not involved in PSG’s opening night win at Le Havre on Friday and the South American is keen to come to Old Trafford. United boss Erik ten Hag wants a midfielder to sit beside Kobbie Mainoo in the holding role and the club have been pursuing Ugarte for weeks.

United are focused on Ugarte after seeing other targets Youssouf Fofana join AC Milan and Berge move to Fulham. They could offer PSG a loan to buy deal, although it is understood they would prefer a straight cash deal.
United do not need to offload anyone to finance Ugarte’s move, although Napoli remain keen on Scotland midfielder McTominay.
However no deal is imminent despite days of talks between United and the Serie A side.

headline: opinionErik ten Hag's £1billion transfer rebuild comments show all that is wrong with Man Utd
body: Manchester United have spent huge sums since hiring Erik ten Hag but the Dutchman believes much more in needed before they can become the team he pictured when he arrived

Manchester United have spent £530million in the transfer market since Erik ten Hag became manager - yet according to the Dutchman himself they are only half-way through the rebuild he envisioned when he arrived at Old Trafford.
When Ten Hag assessed the squad he inherited in the summer of 2022, he estimated it would take him six transfer windows to address the weaknesses he found.

Two years on, and the United boss feels his timetable has had to be redrawn after seeing his plans thwarted by the Premier League ’s Profit and Sustainability Rules and his own failure to secure vital revenue through Champions League qualification.
Despite investing heavily each summer, United's finances have meant the club has not spent a single penny in either of the winter transfer windows of Ten Hag’s reign.

As Ten Hag himself revealed during a summer interview: “United were in a situation where there were a lot of long contracts - and that made it complicated to thoroughly refresh and strengthen the team. When we started, my thought was that in roughly six transfer windows it would be solvable.
“Formally, we have now had four transfer periods, but because of the Financial Fair Play restrictions we have we have only been able to actually do business in two periods.”

Ten Hag has since returned to Old Trafford after being given a vote of confidence by club co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe to see £115million spent on Leny Yoro, Matthijs de Ligt, Joshua Zirkzee and Noussar Mazraoui. The club are also in the market for a new central midfielder.

Frankie de Jong has been Ten Hag’s prime target for the last three summers, but with Barcelona preferring to get Ilkay Gundogan off the wage bill rather than cashing in on the Dutchman, the focus has moved onto Paris St Germain’s Uruguayan international Manuel Ugarte.
PSG will have to slash their £50million asking price on the 23-year-old to make the deal happen - although there are suggestions in France that a loan-now-pay-later alternative is now on the table.

Chief executive Omar Berrada, Director of football Dan Ashworth and technical director Jason Wilcox agree with the manager’s assessment that Brazilian veteran Casemiro and teenager Kobbie Mainoo cannot be expected to cope with the demands of a campaign that will see United compete in the Europa League without reinforcements.

United spent over £200million on signing Antony, Casemiro, Lisandro Martinez and Tyrell Malacia when Ten Hag first arrived. Only Martinez, when fit, has proved to be a success. That same summer they raised less than £20million on sales - although they did save on the wages of the departing Paul Pogba, Nemanja Matic, Juan Mata, Edinson Cavani and Jesse Lingered.

When Ten Hag asked the board for a new striker at the turn of the year, he had to be satisfied with seeing Burnley flop Wout Weghorst arrive on loan alongside Marcel Sabitzer and keeper Martin Dubrovka. Twelve months later, there wasn’t even any money left in the pot to secure any loan deals after a summer which saw another £172million lavished on Rasmus Hojlund, Mason Mount, Andre Onana and Altay Bayindir.
Almost £50million was recouped in departures - and a similar amount has been raised this summer by selling Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Mason Greenwood, Willy Kambwala and Alvaro Fernandez.

Scott McTominay is also likely to depart, but attempts to find buyers for Jadon Sancho, Antony and Victor Lindelöf have not been successful. It means United’s net spend under Ten Hag is hovering around the £400million mark - with no fewer than 13 members of his current squad having been signed by the Dutchman.

Ten Hag said: “When everyone’s fit, we already have a good team and achieve a high level. But we also know, in depth we need more players. There are more games this season, more intense games, no winter break, a January that’s very condensed. You need squad depth. It’s about survival of the fittest.”

headline: Man Utd 'sense' Jadon Sancho could make Premier League transfer before deadline
body: Jadon Sancho has returned to Manchester United but could still depart this summer with those at Old Trafford conscious that Chelsea could make a play for the winger
Manchester United officials sense that Chelsea could still make a play for Jadon Sancho before deadline day.

The winger has returned to Old Trafford after his loan spell at Borussia Dortmund, which came about after a public fallout with manager Erik ten Hag. The pair have since settled their differences and Sancho has returned to the first-team picture this term.

There is talk of him leaving though with PSG having a summer-long interest in the player who moved to Manchester for £70million back in 2021. Saudi Arabian clubs too have been touted as possible buyers but Chelsea also remain an interested party.

The Athletic reports that those at Old Trafford believe a late play from the Blues could be on the cards as they continue to throw money at their squad. Despite adding Pedro Neto and Joao Felix about to join the Chelsea bosses could still move for Sancho.

The Englishman has underwhelmed throughout his time back in the Premier League. Back in his first spell at Dortmund he was one of Europe's most productive players, but he's scored just 12 goals across his 83 appearances in all competitions whilst at the Manchester outfit.

United are willing to accept a major loss on Sancho with a £40m price tag place on the winger, whose demise in recent years has cost him his England spot. Recently Chelsea and the Red Devils did business when Mason Mount left west London and moved north.

Sancho was included in the Community Shield at Wembley, missing a penalty as Manchester City claimed the trophy. However he was left out of the Premier League opener against Fulham with Ten Hag claiming the winger missed out due to illness.

He said: "First of all we need squad depth it is a season of survival of the fittest Jadon in the week had an ear infection and wasn’t 100 per cent fit. He could play but we preferred other players. That will change in season when we need to rotate. Sometimes it is frustrating for the player. But every player will get his chance."

United are still open to selling a number of their first-team stars. Scott McTominay is among those who they will listen to offers for with Victor Lindelof also potentially making his way to the exit door. Casemiro's future has been under the spotlight, although he's featured in the opening games of the season.

headline: Leon Goretzka's blunt Man Utd statement, new stance and brutal Vincent Kompany decision
body: Bayern Munich's Leon Goretzka was once a target for Manchester United, and while the loyal midfielder turned down any notion of the move - that could now be about to change
Former Manchester United target Leon Goretzka appears to be back on the market after being axed from Bayern Munich's squad.

Bayern got their season underway with a 4-0 win over Ulm in the first round of the DFB-Pokal last Friday, but boss Vincent Kompany left out the decorated Germany star from their matchday squad. The Belgian boss opted to keep his cards close to his chest regarding the midfielder's future, saying: "As a club, we always want to be clear with the players, that is the reality. We do that internally within our family. We don't need to say anything publicly."

However, according to Fabrizio Romano, it will be made clear to Goretzka that he will not be a regular starter under Kompany this season, potentially forcing him to look elsewhere for first-team football.

With two years left on his contract in Germany, the 29-year-old faces competition for a place in central midfield from the likes of Joshua Kimmich, Joao Palhinha, Konrad Laimer, Aleksandar Pavlovic and Raphael Guerreiro. While there has been no reported interest from United in Goretzka as yet, that could change with the club in the market for a player of his profile to compliment Kobbie Mainoo in midfield.

What's more, United have toyed with the idea of signing him in the past. The Red Devils made plans to sign Goretzka in 2021 as he struggled to agree new contract terms at Bayern - with his old deal due to run out in 12 months at that point. It was claimed at the time that United had handed the German star a 'concrete offer' to give him what he wanted in terms of a pay rise.

However, Goretzka extended his contract at Bayern in the September of 2021, securing his place in the squad until 2026. He spoke at the time of the extension and shared his joy at staying in Germany, adding: "We’ve won everything there is to win over the past three years. But what would be even better than winning titles is confirming and repeating these successes. We want to build on this in the coming years."

Last year, Goretzka was again linked with a move to Old Trafford and quickly talked down any rumours of him leaving Bayern, telling Sky Germany: "No. I love the club, I love the city, I love the fans."

This led Ten Hag to sign Chelsea midfielder Mason Mount in a £54.7 million move, as well as securing Sofyan Ambrabat's signature on loan from Fiorentina for £7.6m. Erik ten Hag has again expressed his interest in signing another holding midfielder, with targets including PSG star Manuel Ugarte, Monaco's Youssof Fofana and Burnley's Sander Berge.

It was reported that United are planning to wait until the final day of the transfer window to try and sign Ugarte, as they refuse to pay PSG's asking price of over £50m. Fofana has closed off any chance of a move to Manchester by signing for AC Milan in a £21.3m deal, while Berge is on the verge of a move to Fulham after the Cottagers accepted a £25million bid for the former Sheffield United man.
With Scott McTominay's future also still uncertain, it could lead United back to Goretzka, who would seem to be available following his recent omission from Bayern's squad.

headline: Referee at centre of Cristiano Ronaldo controversy handed Man Utd reunion for Brighton trip
body: Manchester United travel to Brighton for their second game of the Premier League season this weekend and will be reunited with a referee who infamously clashed with Cristiano Ronaldo back in 2022
Erik ten Hag will be reunited with the referee who sparked controversy in one of Cristiano Ronaldo's final Manchester United matches this weekend.

The Premier League have confirmed the match official appointments for Round Two of the new season. United kick the weekend off with a Saturday lunchtime trip to Brighton, having beaten Fulham in their opening game.

Craig Pawson is the man who has been charged with keeping order at the AMEX Stadium as the referee. The official infamously found himself at the centre of controversy back in October 2022 when United took on Newcastle.

Ronaldo started the game and thought he had scored when Newcastle defender Fabian Schar rolled the ball to goalkeeper Nick Pope, the apparent kicker. Ronaldo intercepted the apparent pass and put the ball in the net.

But Pawson disallowed the goal, with Newcastle allowed to retake their free-kick. United boss Ten Hag was barely able to conceal his anger at the referee after the match, with Pawson also having denied them two penalty appeals.

"I don't have a comment, everyone has seen it. I shared that with them (the officials). Everyone has seen what happened today on the pitch," Ten Hag fumed having also confronted Pawson and his assistants on the pitch at full-time.

"I don't have a comment on the referee's performance. I'm disappointed with the result, but I'm happy with the performance. We dominated that game in the second half by far. We broke them, but we didn't kill them by not scoring.

"Everyone has seen what happened today on the pitch, so I don't have a comment. As I said, I share [my views] with them. You can try, eh? Everyone has seen the game. You have to judge the performance from the teams and from the refs, not me."

Elsewhere, Michael Oliver will take charge of the weekend's biggest game in which Aston Villa host Arsenal on Saturday evening. Manchester City's clash against Ipswich Town will have Michael Salisbury in the middle.

Anthony Taylor is seen as one of the Premier League's top officials alongside Oliver and he will be in the middle for Everton's trip to Tottenham. Meanwhile, Sam Barrott has been appointed to Southampton's clash with Nottingham Forest despite the controversy surrounding him.

Barrott was in the middle for Brentford's clash with Crystal Palace on Sunday and disallowed a goal for Eberechi Eze after blowing his whistle before the ball hit the back of the net. He apologised for the mistake, with Palace going on to lose.

headline: Mason Mount told he faces 'make or break' moment in Man Utd career after underwhelming start
body: Mason Mount struggled in his debut season for Manchester United after completing a big-money move from boyhood club Chelsea and has been issued a clear instruction by Dimitar Berbatov
Mason Mount has been told to be brave ahead of what is a “make or break” season for Manchester United by Dimitar Berbatov.

The midfielder endured a miserable debut season at Old Trafford last term after a £55m move from boyhood club Chelsea. Injuries limited him to just 20 appearances in all competitions, with Mount scoring just once.

The 36-time England international already appears to have established himself in Erik ten Hag’s thinking during the new campaign. He was named in the starting line-up in the Community Shield clash against Manchester City and again started in the Premier League opener against Fulham.

As he aims to build on that early promise, ex-United striker Berbatov has demanded he put effort into proving his doubters wrong. Speaking to Futbin.com, he said: “My only wish for him is to get through the thought that he is new and that he doesn't want to take responsibility. It is his second season now and he needs to have a good season.
“This is the moment to make or break, so he has to go out there and be brave. Take some chances and risks. He has the quality, so don't be afraid, Mason.”

Berbatov added: “First season was disappointing for him and something to forget. But he can learn from that and what he can learn is to get better. If you give him the opportunity he has to go out and give the best he can. He didn't manage to do that last season unfortunately.
“But the talent and the quality is there. Everybody saw what he did at Chelsea, but he didn't produce it at Manchester United.
“ Bruno Fernandes is a similar type of player, but it is a long season and there are a lot of games to be played, and they need competition. He can make a difference with the passes and his runs.”
Mount has already been given backing by Red Devils manager Erik ten Hag. Speaking earlier this month, the Dutchman suggested that he will return to his top form once he overcomes his injury issues.

He said: “We know he’s a high-class player and just bringing his skills in. Last season, he had a very bad season, a very tough season for him because of all his injuries, so now we are very pleased he had a very good pre-season.
“I’m sure he will now, from this point on, be contributing to the team if he stays fit. That counts for every player.”

headline: Toney, Guehi, Gomez, Sterling - £250m of British talent primed for transfers in next 10 days
body: An unspectacular transfer window so far is set to explode into life over the next week. Big names including England internationals at top clubs are part of a cycle of buying and selling that fans hope will reshape their club's fortunes. But who are the stars for sale?
The futures of some big name experienced internationals are up for grabs with ten days to go before the transfer window shuts.

Clubs are scrambling to balance the books, move on big earners or cash in on home-grown, pure profit stars who are no longer in the starting XI and will do wonders for their Profit and Sustainability balance sheets.

Chief execs are under pressure to buy and sell. Tension, bluff, double bluff, negotiation and compromise is gnawing away behind the scenes.  Mirror Football  looks at the big names up for sale and assesses whether deals can be done to keep these star men, and Premier League title winners, happy with their lot.
At 29, Sterling is far from past it, but his Chelsea career is over, a high profile victim of the London club’s £185m, 11 player, 40+ squad member spending spree.
They need to sell, not only Raheem, but a few others too, but the England veteran is the highest profile.

He’s won four league titles, an FA Cup, five League Cups and a runners up medal in the Champions League as well as 82 England caps, but his statement on Sunday expressing surprise at not being involved against Man City shows he wants to play. Cash rich Crystal Palace could be an ideal destination, or ambitious West Ham.

A few months ago the England striker was being touted as a £100m man, destined for Arsenal, Spurs or Chelsea. It’s not quite worked out like that in terms of football ambition… but Toney’s bank balance will certainly be the beneficiary.

Toney, 28, was left out of Brentford’s opener against Palace, and a £35m offer from Saudi side Al-Ahli rejected. That’s been upped to £50m and Toney looks set to go, earning £20m a year on the way. What it will do to his England career is another matter.

The England defender’s stock has risen since the Euros this summer. Newcastle are confident Guehi wants to join them and become their biggest summer signing. But the Geordies' negotiating skills are being tested to the limit and they have gone to £65/70m without getting their man.

Palace are exploiting the situation brilliantly. The Toon are getting desperate to prove their ambition, and have a new Sporting Director Paul Mitchell, and chief exec Darren Eales now in charge of bartering, and both are under pressure… and Palace know it! I suspect that deal will get done, eventually, with a few twists on the way.
An accomplished England and Liverpool defender, there should be plenty of takers for Gomez, who was left out of the Anfield squad at the weekend as he considers his transfer future.

A move depends on Liverpool not pricing him out of one. The 27-year-old offers Newcastle an experienced alternative to Guehi, but they’d prefer Jarell Quansah. Aston Villa would be attractive given their Champions League campaign ahead, and Palace could also get in on the defender merry-go-round.
Sancho wasn’t involved in Manchester United ’s opener against Fulham on Friday and looks set for another loan deal, or if United get their way, a sale.

United have spent more than £155m on four new stars this window and could do with balancing the books after backing Erik ten Hag on and off the pitch. It is unlikely his fall out with Ten Hag will be smoothed over.
Another big asset left out of United’s squad for the first game. It is time for the Scotland international to move on and become a leading light at a mid-table club.
Talks with Fulham have been revived, while there is a question mark over whether Everton could afford his £30m price tag.
The England right back has a year left on his Toon contract. He’s just been made vice-captain at Newcastle but was not in their starting XI against Southampton, with Tino Livramento ahead of him.

Trippier had to turn out for the Uunder 21 team on Monday night for fitness work. Time for a move? Boss Eddie Howe wants to keep him, and all of his squad, but there could be pressure from above to cash in for £10m. 'Tripps' is a huge player for United, but a three or four year deal elsewhere, possibly abroad, would surely be tempting.

headline: Fulham could help Man Utd land No.1 transfer target despite hijacking move for midfielder
body: Manchester United remain active in the summer transfer market with 10 days left until the window slams shut, but they now need the help of Premier League rivals Fulham
Fulham have hijacked Manchester United's move for Sander Berge, but the Cottagers could still help their Premier League rivals to land Manuel Ugarte.

United had appeared to move on from the Uruguyan midfielder after talks with PSG stalled. One of their targets was thought to be Berge, with Burnley willing to sell the Norwegian following their relegation.

But Fulham have stolen a march on the Red Devils and are closing in on a £25million deal for the 26-year-old. The Cottagers have money to spend after selling Joao Palhinha to Bayern Munich for £47.4m.

With money still remaining in their warchest, there have been suggestions that they could reignite their interest in Scott McTominay. The Scot is a prime candidate to leave Old Trafford this summer having been relegated to the role of squad player last season.

According to The Athletic, United's focus for the final two weeks of the window is on outgoings and talks have stepped up over McTominay's exit. While Napoli are one of the interested suitors, Fulham have also been eyeing a move.

United are seeking a fee in the region of £25m for the 27-year-old and have already rejected several offers from the Cottagers below that fee. Despite signing Berge, Fulham could still return for McTominay.

There is an expectation that a decision on a move will be left until late in the window, which closes at 11pm on 30 August. Fulham boss Marco Silva has warned his side still have a lot of work to do to rebuild their squad following several key exits.

“We lost four starters [in the transfer window. We are probably the only team in the Premier League that lost four starters. We have to rebuild again. There is a lot of work for us to do over the next two weeks to rebuild," he told Match of the Day after the defeat to United last Friday.

“But we are very pleased with how the players have worked. We are working hard to get what we need. When the game becomes open we should have kept the balance and kept compact. But in those moments we lost emotional control and that allowed them to score.

“The game was open and broken – we tried to rush our decisions. Many times we started to lose the ball too quickly. We let the game go too emotional and we didn’t want that. Frustration with the result for us. Big frustration for our players and fans, for sure."

If some of that work involved signing McTominay, it may allow United to find a breakthrough for Ugarte. The Red Devils have been in negotiations with PSG for the midfielder for some time and would have the money to match the French side's valuation if McTominay moved on.

Ugarte has been Erik ten Hag's top target for central midfield all summer, with PSG willing to allow him to leave after just one season at the Parc des Princes. PSG are seeking a fee of £51m for the 23-year-old.

headline: 10 Premier League takeaways as Arsenal and Liverpool stars break records and Jamie Vardy returns
body: Mohamed Salah and William Saliba both set records as Liverpool and Arsenal recorded opening weekend wins with Jamie Vardy making his presence known on his return to the Premier League
The Premier League returned with the opening weekend spanning four days as several big hitters staked their claims.

Manchester United's win over Fulham on Friday night, owing to a late winner from Joshua Zirkzee, proved that old habits die hard before Liverpool welcomed Ipswich back to the top flight. Mohamed Salah came up with his customary strike on the opening day as Arne Slot was introduced to the Premier League.
Newcastle and Aston Villa are looking to prove that them breaking into the establishment in the past couple of seasons is not a flash in the pan with both ambitious outfits claiming victory.

Arsenal got their campaign off to the best possible start with a win over Wolves before they saw Manchester City respond 24 hours later in true champion style. Missing some of their key cogs - Rodri among them - they made light work of Chelsea as they embark on their latest bid for glory.
Tottenham concluded the weekend as they were forced to settle for a point at Leicester, when nearly all of their rivals picked up three. Here are the takeaways from the opening weekend.

United left several of their new signings on the bench for their opening clash against Fulham. Zirkzee and Matthijs de Ligt were introduced late on and - with the game meandering towards a goalless draw - the club's new Dutch forward came up with the winning goal.

Despite all the talk of change in Manchester the Red Devils themselves certainly didn't look a new and improved outfit. Fulham had their chances but, in front of the new INEOS hierarchy, it was the win that was most crucial on Friday night and Zirkzee's neat touch from Alejandro Garnacho's cross provided it.

When the Egyptian scored for Liverpool in a 3-3 draw with Watford on the opening weekend in 2017 few could've foreseen the goal machine he would become. Even less likely was the prospect of Salah scoring on the opening day almost every time he took to the pitch for the Reds.

He netted their second in the 2-0 success over Ipswich and, in doing so, scored for the opening weekend for the ninth time, setting another Premier League record, with the only time he failed to score in a season opener coming at Chelsea last season when he assisted Luis Diaz and had a goal ruled out for a marginal offside. There has been talk of the frontman leaving sooner rather than later with his contract winding down, but he continues to offer reminders of just how integral he is.

The Frenchman has transformed the Gunners' back four and his inclusion in the first-team has coincided with their rapid rise under Mikel Arteta. When Saliba plays Arsenal are a notably better team and his absence is often telling. He picked up another clean sheet against Wolves and also a slice of history.

Saliba went into the clash on Saturday having won 49 games as an Arsenal player, with victory seeing him hit half a century of wins quicker than any Gunners player in the Premier League. It was a record previously held by Nacho Monreal, but Saliba has now replaced him on the list.

Fabian Hürzeler wasn't even born when the Premier League began. Sean Dyche in contrast has proved himself to be a shrewd Premier League operator and had his Everton side playing at home against new look Brighton.

The result therefore, a 3-0 success for the visitors, proved that Hürzeler's infancy will be no hinderance for the Seagulls this term. Brighton looked as good as they did under Roberto De Zerbi, playing with their own new style after a summer in which they may have acquired yet more quality that has gone under the radar - Yankuba Minteh among them.

A team who have three efforts on goal beat a team who had 19. That was the story of the day at St James' Park as newly promoted Southampton couldn't find a way past the dogged Newcastle defence, spurred on after they'd seen one of their own sent off.

Tempers flared and Fabian Schar paid the price when he clashed with Ben Brereton Diaz, leading to a straight red. It left the Magpies with an uphill battle as more than an hour of the contest remained but they were clinical in a way the Saints simply weren't. A misplaced pass allowed Alexander Isak to provide the assist for match winner Joelinton.

Denied by an 86th minute equaliser, but Nottingham Forest were good value for much of their clash with Bournemouth. They looked on course for victory, which would've been the ideal start given some have quietly tipped the City Ground outfit for the drop.

One thing - or two - that will certainly help their cause is the quality of their wingers. Callum Hudson-Odoi and Anthony Elanga - two men once tipped for solid careers at Chelsea and Manchester United respectively - now find themselves rebuilding their careers in Nottingham and are poised to be looked upon to deliver time and time again this term.

Their stunning end to the season has some believing Crystal Palace could upset the European party, but defeat to Brentford on the opening weekend wasn't the ideal start. Less than ideal was the refereeing blunder committed by Sam Barrott - who later owned his mistake.

He blew up before Eberechi Eze's smart free-kick hit the back of the net, meaning VAR couldn't intervene. The foul the ref thinks he saw was certainly debatable and may well have been overturned if those at Stockley Park had a chance to take a look - but we'll never know. Let's hope its not the start of things to come with officials too often a talking point last term.

The clash at the London Stadium was one team with European ambitions against a team who have fulfilled them. Go back a year or two and Aston Villa will have themselves where West Ham currently are - beginning a journey by landing a quality Spanish manager and backing him in the transfer market.

Villa though proved that they certainly are further along in their own story as they left London with three points - which are likely to age well with West Ham poised to improve as the year goes on. Unai Emery will have been thrilled to see his £50m signing Amadou Onana bag himself a debut goal.

Much was made of City's record minus their Spanish star last term. In the four matches he was absent they lost three with Pep Guardiola simply having no one capable of filling the void left by the man who many have tipped to win the Ballon d'Or. He only returned to training last week and thus was left out for the win at Chelsea.

A former Blue in Mateo Kovacic stepped in and helped City dominate against the lavishly assembled midfield at Stamford Bridge. The Croatian would score the visitors' second after Erling Haaland began his hopes of a third Golden Boot with yet another strike as the quest for five titles in a row begins.

He's been one of the Premier League's most divisive figures for the best part of a decade. The Leicester City frontman engages with fans - for better or worse - like few others and his parting gift to the travelling Tottenham faithful was to deny them three points and remind them of their trophy drought.

Vardy's header cancelled out Pedro Porro's opener before the veteran frontman was withdrawn as he wrestles with an injury issue. Before walking off he pointed to the Premier League badge on his shirt, citing his own success in 2016, before reminding Tottenham they are yet to match his feat.

headline: Gary Neville’s colleague gave brutal three-word assessment of Sky Sports performance
body: Gary Neville has become one of the UK's leading sports broadcasters during his time with Sky Sports - but it wasn't always positive feedback for the former Manchester United captain
Gary Neville is one of the UK's most respected pundits – but one of his old-team-mates wasn't particularly impressed with his start to life on Sky Sports.

The former United captain is now in his 13th year as a sports broadcaster, having joined Sky Sports at the beginning of the 2011/12 season. He has become one of the country's brightest football analysts in that time, forming a great relationship with Jamie Carragher and presenter Dave Jones.

But his first forays into TV were far from the finished article, with old Manchester United team-mate Nicky Butt even claiming Neville was "s***" in his early days on Monday Night Football. Butt was once very critical of Neville's debut on Sky Sports, as he was seen looking pretty shaky while speaking to former Manchester City boss Roberto Mancini.

In his debut on MNF in 2011, Neville stuttered over his words, leaving Butt unimpressed by his performance. The 49-year-old told The Athletic in 2021 that he wasn't enamoured with Neville's debut, but admitted that his old team-mate went on to prove him wrong in time. He said: "As a manager, you’ll have tough times and get cr*p off the press. I know that – and I’m fine with the media.

"I wasn’t when I started in my first interviews – or my first managerial speeches, but you learn. I remember seeing Nev on Sky Sports at first and he was s***, and I told him. Now he’s the best, by a mile. And you have to be prepared for questions – journalists have a job to do too."

Neville has continued to impress since his initial start and now sets the standard punditry. He began his 14th year on Monday Night Football last night (Monday, August 18) as Tottenham Hotspur began their Premier League season against Leicester City at the King Power Stadium.

Since 2011, Neville has won the Sports Pundit award at the 2014, 2015 and 2022 Royal Television Society (RTS) awards. MNF also won the best Sports Programme honour at the 2016 RTS awards, and the Television Show of the Year prize at the 2024 Sports Journalists' Association Awards, which showcases the popularity of the programme.

Neville has gained traction for his detailed insight on the game, as well as his rivalry with Carragher. He is considered one of - if not, the best - football pundit, but he was once of the same opinion as Butt about his TV appearances.

headline: Gary Neville makes surprising claim as he clashes with Jamie Carragher over Man Utd prediction
body: Manchester United have a stronger midfield than Liverpool and will finish two places higher than them in the Premier League this season, according to Gary Neville
Gary Neville is backing Manchester United to finish two places higher than Liverpool in the Premier League this season because they have a better midfield.

Neville and Jamie Carragher made their predictions for the 2024/25 campaign in the Sky Sports studio on Monday night after Tottenham’s 1-1 draw with Leicester. As ever, the duo did not agree on much, with Neville backing Arsenal to pip Manchester City to the title, while Carragher is convinced City’s domination will continue.

But it was when it came to discussing their former clubs that things got particularly interesting, with their predictions mirroring each other. While Carragher said Liverpool would finish third, two places ahead of United in fifth, Neville went for the exact opposite – and when it came to explaining why, the former United defender struggled to justify himself.

Asked by Dave Jones which areas of the United team were superior to Liverpool’s, Neville took a long pause and then replied: “Ermmm, I wouldn’t say they were superior in respects of a particular area. I think Liverpool have got a better team than Manchester United. Liverpool have got far better forwards, that is the thing that they do have.

“I think in midfield, if I look at Manchester United’s midfield players, if you add equal coaches – and we don’t know what Erik ten Hag and Arne Slot are going to match up like – I do think Liverpool, with [Wataru] Endo, [Dominik] Szoboszlai and [Alexis] Mac Allister, they’ve done unbelievably well to get the performance levels out of those three that they have with Jurgen Klopp.

"I really do question [whether] that midfield three is going to stand up throughout the season. If it does again, I’ll take my hat off to them, ‘well done, unbelievable, you’ve proven me wrong’. I think Manchester United have got more in midfield, more depth, good players in there…”

Carragher then cut in: “That was Manchester United’s biggest problem last year, in midfield! The whole of the middle of the pitch!” Neville replied: “It was the structure of the midfield. Kobbie Mainoo has come into that midfield alongside Casemiro. [Bruno] Fernandes is in there, Mason Mount, McTominay – they’ve got five players in there that I think…”
Carragher: “How many are you going to play? You’ve just named six players there!” Neville: “I said they’ve got more depth in there.”

Liverpool are clearly happy with their depth in midfield, having opted not to reinforce the team after failing in their efforts to sign Real Sociedad’s Martin Zubimendi for £50million. Meanwhile, United are hoping to bring in Paris Saint-Germain star Manuel Ugarte to bolster Ten Hag’s midfield, while McTominay could leave.

headline: Cristiano Ronaldo tipped for Man Utd comeback as star has 'unfinished business'
body: Cristiano Ronaldo has already made one miraculous return to Old Trafford during his career, and now he's been tipped to do the same again by one of his old team-mates
Cristiano Ronaldo could return to Manchester United in the future as a coach or manager, according to his former team-mate Louis Saha.

The Portuguese star's name will forever be synonymous with the club thanks to his first spell at Old Trafford. His second stint didn't quite go to plan, with Ronaldo eventually leaving by mutual consent after a notorious interview with Piers Morgan.

Ronaldo, who is still playing out in Saudi Arabia for Al-Nassr, turns 40 in 2025. He hasn't confirmed either way what his future holds, both at club level or internationally ahead of the 2026 World Cup in the United States.

Despite his infamous 'coaching' on the sidelines during his nation's Euro 2016 final triumph, the superstar hasn't gone public with any stance on a future managerial career, either. But that hasn't deterred Saha from believing he'd be great in the dugout, potentially at Old Trafford.
"Cristiano Ronaldo has the passion and dedication to return to Manchester United one day," Saha told TVSporten. "That could be as a coach or even a manager.

"His second spell didn’t end how everyone had hoped, and you can see why that frustrated him. He didn’t see the same formula and didn’t see the passion from young players that he had been used to seeing."
Ronaldo's second spell at United was turbulent, to say the least. He played under three different managers and criticised the club and its hierarchy before being released in November 2022.

It was the icon's interview with Piers Morgan that all but ended his second stint at the club, with his disapproval of Ten Hag and the club's younger players proving to be the final nail in the coffin.

Ronaldo still scored 27 goals in 54 games during that spell, however, and will always be remembered fondly by United fans overall. He has since been enjoying his time in Saudi Arabia with Al Nassr, having scored 35 goals in his first full season at the club.

He will reportedly stay put this season, but his future beyond that remains a mystery. The forward's old United team-mate Saha has tipped Ronaldo to head into coaching, but only if he improves a few of his personable skills.
"Now he will know that he needs to find a new way to communicate when he becomes a coach," added Saha. "Which maybe isn’t as harsh or direct as it was when he was at the club.

"He will work out how to be successful and use all his knowledge to do that; we’ve seen Roy Keane go into management and have success. Cristiano will understand what he needs to do as a manager. I see no reason why he wouldn’t be a success."

headline: Liverpool 'identify' replacement for key star at knockdown price as Arne Slot 'eyes' deal
body: Andy Robertson has been a stalwart at the back for Liverpool since 2017, and may have a successor on his hands in the form of an Olympic medallist
Liverpool are reportedly interested in 22-year-old French left-back Adrien Truffert, who could eventually replace Andy Robertson.

Arne Slot's reign at Anfield got off to the perfect start in the Premier League on Saturday as they beat newly-promoted Ipswich 2-0. However, the transfer market hasn't proved quite so easy for the Dutchman.

The Reds haven't brought anyone in this summer, missing out on the likes of Anthony Gordon and Martin Zubimendi. It now appears they are in the market for Truffert, who excelled at the Paris Olympics and could provide the perfect understudy for Robertson, while not costing as much as previous failed targets.
According to L'Equipe, the Reds – alongside fellow Premier League clubs Nottingham Forest, Wolves and Manchester United – are all interested in securing the young Frenchman's services.

Truffert graduated from his current club Rennes' academy, and is one of the country's premier defensive prospects. At just 22, he's played over 150 times for his boyhood club, contributing 21 assists in the meantime.
The youngster is currently valued at around £15.3m but, given his age and the fact that his contract doesn't expire until 2026, any fee paid for Truffert could rise higher.

PSG, who have recently signed Truffert's starlet of a team-mate and fellow Olympian Desire Doue, reportedly held an interest in the defender and could return for him on the back of Lucas Hernandez's injury.

The French champions identified Truffert as a target prior to the Paris Olympics, but playing under Thierry Henry at the Games only highlighted the youngster's talent to the rest of Europe and beyond.

Truffert was a standout player for Les Bleus, commandingly shoring up the left side of the field while also marauding forward, much like Robertson, the man he could potentially replace or deputise for.
While current backup Kostas Tsimikas signed a new long-term deal at the club last September, he is 28. Like Robertson, will need someone younger to either take over or act as a stand-in.
Robertson hasn't been rocked by any rumours of potential arrival at left-back, though, instead choosing to be excited by Slot's arrival and what the future may hold for Liverpool.

"Look, I’ve not really given it much thought," Robertson told Sky Sports prior to Euro 2024 when discussing his Anfield future. "Obviously, I’ll now try and switch off physically, mentally, like I always try and do.
"Then, it will be full focus on the new era at Liverpool and trying to get off to the best possible start, helping in every way possible to make that successful for him as well.
"I’ve got no doubts that we can keep that momentum going, and from all the reports we’ve had, the manager is very good, and I can’t wait to see that up close.

"You have to be open-minded because the last eight or nine years were pretty special, and we just knew the way it was going. All other clubs were changing managers and things like that but we knew what we had and what we were going to get. And now, they’re going a bit into the unknown from the fans’ point of view, but it has to be exciting."

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Two deals handed boost as Scott McTominay talks revived
body: With the season up and running and less than a fortnight of the summer transfer window left to go, Manchester United have a few remaining pieces of business they need to wrap up
Manchester United have less than two weeks left to make some last-minute additions to their squad to help them improve on last season's showing.

Erik ten Hag has already welcomed in four new faces, two of whom were already familiar to him. Former Ajax defenders Noussair Mazraoui and Matthijs de Ligt have joined from Bayern Munich, following Joshua Zirkzee and Leny Yoro to Old Trafford.
United began their campaign with a win against Fulham thanks to a late Zirkzee strike. Their manager may well feel there are gaps left to plug, though, especially after last season's injury woes.
We may well also see some more departures before the window shuts, as Ten Hag streamlines his squad. That's where some of our focus lies as we bring you all the latest.

Fulham haven't given up on luring Scott McTominay to Craven Cottage. Marco Silva's side saw a bid knocked back earlier in the summer, and Sky Sports suggest they could be ready to improve on that £20m bid.
Napoli are also in the mix, and their opening day Serie A defeat could spur them into action. Manager Antonio Conte suggested more signings were on the way after a dismal 3-0 reverse at Verona.

McTominay came on as a substitute in the Community Shield and again in the Premier League opener. Nearly half of his 32 league appearances last season came from the bench, but only two United players bettered his return of seven goals in the competition.

Manchester United have opened talks with Panathinaikos over a move for Facundo Pellistri, according to The Athletic. United want around £8.5million for the Uruguay international, who is in the final year of his contract.

The 22-year-old moved to Old Trafford in 2020, but had to wait more than two years for his debut. He played 14 times in the first half of last season, but was allowed to spend the second half of the campaign on loan at Granada.

United have welcomed Amad and Jadon Sancho back into the fold in the last 12 months after both looked close to an exit at various points. With plenty of competition for places, the club are not expected to stand in the way of a move for Pellistri, though Greek side Panathinaikos aren't the only interested party.

Manchester United have lodged a bid for Sander Berge which falls short of Burnley's valuation, according to The Mail. The same publication indicates the Norwegian remains an option, but that United would prioritise Manuel Ugarte if Paris Saint-Germain lower their asking price.

PSG are thought to want their money back on Ugarte, who joined from Sporting CP for around £60m last summer. The Uruguay international wasn't part of Luis Enrique's squad for the opening day win against Le Havre in Ligue 1.

Berge joined Burnley from Sheffield United for a reported £12m last summer, with the Clarets after £30m for tne Norway international. He has missed the first two games of the 2024-25 season as he works his way back form injury.

headline: Man Utd's new Manuel Ugarte transfer plan as Sander Berge heads elsewhere
body: Manchester United are still keen on landing Manuel Ugarte from PSG and are ready to bide their time with their chase set to go down until the wire as they try and drive down his price
Manchester United are prepared to wait until deadline day to land Manuel Ugarte as they wait for PSG to lower their asking price.

The Uruguayan has been a summer-long target for the Red Devils, but they are currently unwilling to meet the valuation set by the Ligue 1 champions. They only signed Ugarte from Sporting Lisbon 12 months ago but want to make a profit if they do move him on.

United are keen but not at the current price being asked. PSG landed Joao Neves from Benfica earlier this summer and are happy to move Ugarte on. The Red Devils are ready to wait until deadline day in an effort to convince the Parisians to drop their fee.
Currently they want just over £50million but, despite wanting a midfielder, the Manchester outfit are ready to sit tight, according to the Guardian.

As their Ugarte pursuit rambles on it has forced those at Old Trafford to consider other players - Sander Berge at Burnley among them. The midfielder was on their radar several years ago but went elsewhere. Now it is Fulham who have tabled a bid to land the Burnley star.

If the Clarets accept and Berge does head to Craven Cottage then it would leave United's options looking increasingly limited. A permanent swoop for Sofyan Amrabat, who was on loan in Manchester last season, is another option being considered by the hierarchy.

Ugarte's PSG future remains uncertain with the Uruguayan left out of their squad at the weekend, fuelling suggestions his time in Paris is going to be limited. Last term Chelsea were keen on landing the player, but they were out bidded by the French outfit.

United are also open to a number of sales should they receive suitable offers. Scott McTominay, who was also on Fulham's radar, and Victor Lindelof are one of a number of players who could depart Old Trafford for the right fee. Casemiro is another man whose future remains unclear.

Ten Hag has underlined his desire to bring in more new faces: “We can't stand still." When further asked about which positions he would look to further strengthen, the manager added: "It depends what happens in the market, but I am happy with the squad and I think when we have this squad, I am quite confident ahead of the new season."

headline: Man Utd's Andre Onana slammed for 'risks' claim despite Peter Schmeichel backing
body: Andre Onana endured a difficult debut season at Manchester United last term and has sparked fresh concern after insisting he will continue to play a high-risk, high-reward style
Andre Onana has been slammed for claiming he will take more 'risks' for Manchester United this season.

Onana endured a difficult debut campaign at Old Trafford last season, conceding a whopping 83 goals in all competitions. The Cameroon keeper was able to hold onto just 13 clean sheets in his 51 appearances after joining from Inter Milan.
Several of the goal he conceded came from mistakes the United star made himself. Despite that, the 28-year-old has insisted he will continue to look to play a high-risk, high-reward game.

That revelation has come as a shock to former United keeper Tim Howard, who won the FA Cup and the League Cup with the Red Devils. The American has urged Onana to revert to a more conservative game during his second year at the club.

"I’m rarely surprised at things in football. [But] I was utterly shocked to hear Onana say ‘be prepared I will take a lot more risks this season’. He conceded 58 goals, that number has to come down," Howard told NBC Sports
"He can ill-afford to make too many mistakes. Some of the goals that went past him were very, very saveable. The fact he’s willing to take more risks I guess is exciting and compelling.
"I wasn’t convinced last year, but right now he has a lot to prove. He has brilliant ability but he hasn’t put that into place and too many goals are going in that need to be saved."

While Howard is concerned over Onana's free spirit, United legend Peter Schmeichel has given his full backing to the Cameroon international. Schmeichel even tipped the current United No.1 to become a 'world-class' keeper.

“I just thought he was a bit unlucky for two reasons,” he told GOAL. “First of all, not playing behind a consistent defence. That’s a problem as a goalkeeper. You can be the best goalkeeper in the world, but if your defence is not protecting you, you have a problem.

“Secondly, the goal he conceded in Munich was unlucky; if you do that for Inter or Ajax, it goes away within a week or two. If you do that for Man United, it stays, and you will be a goalkeeper who makes mistakes. That’s just the cruel reality of playing for Man United.

“I saw a lot of improvements with different things in his game over the season. He needs help like any other goalkeeper in the world, he needs a defence in front of him. If he’s got that, I’m sure we’ll have a world-class, top-quality goalkeeper who will do well.”

Onana has started both of United's games so far this season - in the Community Shield and against Fulham. He kept a clean sheet in the latter to help his side start the Premier League season with a win.

headline: Manchester United agree defender transfer after finally striking permanent deal
body: Manchester United youngster Will Fish impressed on loan at Hibs in Scotland last season and has been monitored by a number of Championship clubs - now he's set to complete a switch on a permanent basis
Manchester United defender Will Fish is leaving Old Trafford to join Cardiff City on a permanent deal.

Fish, 21, has been keen to leave United this summer for regular first-team football, having impressed on loan at Scottish side Hibernian last term., where he made 45 appearances. His performances north of the border have seen a host of Championship clubs monitoring his situation over the summer.
A number of clubs have pitched temporary and permanent moves for Fish, but he was determined to seal a move away on a permanent basis.
Now Welsh side Cardiff have struck a deal with United to take him to south Wales.

The move is bittersweet for Fish as he's leaving his boyhood club. But with no sign of a breakthrough at United on the horizon, he made clear that he needed to move to pastures new, cutting ties with United, to enable his career to really progress.
He has had to wait however, having been called onto United's pre-season tour of the United States, picking up an injury against Liverpool - resulting in him leaving the field on a stretcher.

According to the Manchester Evening News, United insiders considered Fish's temporary spell with Hibernian as one of the most successful loans they had arranged and he is departing with the best wishes of staff.
Born in Denton, Fish was handed his United debut during Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's reign, at the age of just 17, appearing against Wolves on the final day of the Premier League season in May 2021.

headline: Gary Neville interrupted on the street as Man Utd legend shows his true colours
body: Sky Sports pundit and commentator Gary Neville celebrated the return of Monday Night Football on TikTok, and he even had an audience while walking down the street
Monday Night Football pundit Gary Neville is just as watchable away from the studio as he is inside it, it turns out.

The Manchester United legend has been busy marking the return of a key piece of Premier League programming on Monday evening. Tottenham will open their season with a trip to promoted Leicester City on MNF, and Neville will be following the action along with fellow pundit Jamie Carragher and host Dave Jones from 6.30pm.

In anticipation of the elite coverage and the match, Neville filmed himself heading down the street on a morning walk after going to the gym, describing his excitement to see Monday Night Football back on TV. And he wasn't the only one, it seems.

Just as the former right-back was teeing up his return to MNF, he passed a group of construction workers who recognised the famous face. And Neville, 49, was only too happy to stop for a quick question in front of his 1.7million TikTok followers.
He asked the trio of tradesmen: "Are you watching Monday Night Football tonight?" And he was greeted by a chorus of cheers.
One poor punter was sadly left hanging as he put his hand up for a quick high five, but the gesture was awkwardly missed as Neville went about his way.
However, the masses nonetheless lapped up the exchange as many fans poured on their praise in the comments section.
"Best pundit on British TV," remarked one supporter in response to Neville's Monday morning updated. Another wrote: "MNF is always better when you and Carra are on together."

Neville retired from football in 2011 and was put to work as a match analyst on Sky Sports within a few months. He replaced Andy Gray in the role and was been a major success, with even fans of United's rivals often praising the quality of his insight over the years.
The Old Trafford icon appears raring to go for the game at the King Power Stadium tonight. And with the kind of support like that witnessed walking down the street, it's little wonder as to why.

headline: Sir Jim Ratcliffe bids to follow Arsenal and Man City with money-making Man Utd plan
body: Sir Jim Ratcliffe has seen the success of the documentaries made by Manchester United's rivals and is reportedly planning something similar about the INEOS takeover
The upheaval at Manchester United since the arrival of Sir Jim Ratcliffe in February reportedly could be turned into a documentary.

Ratcliffe has implemented widespread changes after completing a 27.7 per cent takeover of United earlier this year. The British petrochemicals billionaire has brought in some of his own INEOS people to run the club alongside hiring new staff and making hundreds of others redundant.

The new regime brought in consultants to see where they could make savings and decided in July to make 250 redundancies as part of a major restructuring. Erik ten Hag only kept his job as manager by the skin of his teeth after winning the FA Cup and has been rewarded with four summer signings, worth a combined £150million.

The aim behind all this drama is to make United successful once again and turn a profit for Ratcliffe and the Glazer family, who still have a stake in the club. It could also become content in its own right, with Ratcliffe believing that a behind the scenes documentary would go down well with fans.

The Times reports that Ratcliffe has been keeping a video diary since February and a sports writer has been hired to document things. Matt Dickinson will write a book about the early stages of INEOS’ work at United and it could then be turned into a documentary too.

As well as struggling on the pitch in recent years, United have fallen behind their rivals when it comes to content creation. Manchester City, Arsenal and Tottenham have all cashed in by making documentaries, which offer fans a peek behind the curtain and have sold well on streaming platforms.

The All Or Nothing series involving City, Arsenal and Spurs have been huge hits for Amazon. Liverpool have footage from Jurgen Klopp ’s final season in charge but have yet to decide what to do with it. Amazon Prime released a series about the 1999 United side, entitled 99, over the summer and could be interested in another documentary.

Speaking in February, Ratcliffe outlined his goals for United. “We have to ensure that the right people end up in the right positions,” he said. “Every person in management must be world-class. And then it is important to create a positive, supportive, friendly and high-quality environment. That culture was missing before. Only in such an environment can you get the best out of sportsmen. If successful, the results will follow automatically. That's the plan and I believe in it.”

United kicked off their Premier League season with a 1-0 win over Fulham on Friday night, with new signing Joshua Zirkzee scoring a late winner after coming off the bench. The match also saw Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui make their United debuts following transfers from Bayern Munich.

headline: LiveMan Utd transfer news LIVE: Hannibal talks ongoing, Sancho questions, Ugarte and Toney latest
body: Manchester United still have plenty of transfer business to complete in the final week of the window and could yet sign Manuel Ugarte while Scott McTominay and Christian Eriksen could depart
Manchester United are still active in the transfer window and could see players could seal deals for players in and out of the club before the end of the month.

The Red Devils have already seen an impact from the transfers completed in time for the season as Joshua Zirkzee made the difference  against Fulham. The Dutchman was one of three players to make their debut at Old Trafford as Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui also featured for the first time, though Leny Yoro has been made to wait for a competitive debut due to injury.

The transfer rumour mill is in full swing as links to Federico Chiesa, Ivan Toney and Ben Chilwell continue with just over a week left to get deals done. It is midifeld that is now the club's priority however, even though Casemiro now looks poised to stay.

Manuel Ugarte was left out of Paris Saint-Germain's squad this past weekend and United could even launch a late loan deal to convince the French side of a move. Back-up option Sander Berge is set to join Fulham, with the Clarets keen on Hannibal Mejbri as a replacement for the Norwegian.
Further epartures could be required to help make room in the North West too. Scott McTominay has fielded interest from Napoli, while Christian Eriksen has reportedly been offered to Ajax.
Jadon Sancho's future must also be decided upon, with PSG among the clubs to be linked. Follow all of the latest updates throughout the day below.
Chelsea are closing in on Joao Felix, with the Portugal star poised to join from Atletico Madrid,
The deal will allow Conor Gallagher to move in the opposite direction, with both players thought to be on the move for a little over £30m.
90min report that some around Old Trafford believe Chelsea could make a late move for Sancho, though there has been no substance to those talks as of yet.

Joao Felix joins an already bulky front-line in West London, with Pedro Neto joining earlier in the summer and the likes of Cole Palmer, Christopher Nkunku, Mykhailo Mudryk and Noni Madueke all capable of holding down starting spots out wide, though fellow forward Raheem Sterling may be on the move before the end of the month.
Manchester United have reduced their asking price for Panathinaikos target Facundo Pellistri, according to Greek outlet Sport 24 (via Sport Witness).
The club are now thought to be prepared to part with the Uruguayan for just €6m, around half their initial demands.
Pellistri is expected to sign a four-year deal with Panathinaikos, having entered the final year of his contract at Old Trafford.
Manchester United's striker search is unlikely to prompt a move for Ivan Toney, according to The Athletic.
The England international has been the subject of transfer interest from Saudi Arabia, and was left out of Brentford's squad for their victory over Crystal Palace on Sunday.
United could yet add a striker if they're able to raise funds through further sales, but Toney is reported to have been ruled out based on his wages and the fee required to sign him.
Manuel Ugarte remains an option for Manchester United, but Paris Saint-Germain could also lose Carlos Soler this summer.
The Spaniard has been on the radar of West Ham, with reports on the continent indicating contact has been made.
Unlike Ugarte, Soler travelled to Le Havre for PSG's league opener, but remained on the bench for the 4-1 win.
Manchester United's Under-21 side will begin their EFL Trophy campaign against Barnsley tonight.
United's youngsters will also face Doncaster and Huddersfield in the group stage of the competition.
Last season brought a group stage exit, while youngsters including Willy Kambwala and Ethan Wheatley got minutes before tasting senior action later in the campaign.
Manchester United's hopes of sigining Giorgi Mamardashvili appear dead, with The Athletic reporting that Liverpool have agreed a fee for the Valencia goalkeeper.
United had been linked with a potential hijacking of the move for the 23-year-old, who starred for Georgia at Euro 2024.
Mamardashvili is expected to stay at Valencia for the current season before moving to Anfield in 2025.
Juventus will be without Tim Weah for an extended period after the forward picked up a hamstring injury against Como.
The American international scored late in the first half but didn't make it out for the second period.
With Weah out for a number of weeks, reports on the continent have been linking Juve with Jadon Sancho, though nothing has been too concrete.
Might the injury also change Juve's stance on Federico Chiesa among Premier League links? We'll find out in the coming days.
While Sander Berge no longer looks set for an Old Trafford move, his switch to Fulham could prove helpful.
The Norway international is on his way to Craven Cottage from Burnley, ostensibly as a replacement for Joao Palhinha.
The Berge money could allow Burnley to snap up Hannibal Mejbri, though, in turn giving United funds of their own.
Former Manchester United target Leon Goretzka appears to be back on the market after being axed from Bayern Munich's squad.

Bayern got their season underway with a 4-0 win over Ulm in the first round of the DFB-Pokal last Friday, but boss Vincent Kompany left out the decorated Germany star from their matchday squad. The Belgian boss opted to keep his cards close to his chest regarding the midfielder's future, saying: "As a club, we always want to be clear with the players, that is the reality. We do that internally within our family. We don't need to say anything publicly."

However, according to Fabrizio Romano, it will be made clear to Goretzka that he will not be a regular starter under Kompany this season, potentially forcing him to look elsewhere for first-team football.
Some thoughts from our man Simon Mullock...

"Manchester United have spent £530million in the transfer market since Erik ten Hag became manager - yet according to the Dutchman himself they are only half-way through the rebuild he envisioned when he arrived at Old Trafford...."
Read more here.
Manchester United officials sense that Chelsea could still make a play for Jadon Sancho before deadline day.

The winger has returned to Old Trafford after his loan spell at Borussia Dortmund, which came about after a public fallout with manager Erik ten Hag. The pair have since settled their differences and Sancho has returned to the first-team picture this term.

There is talk of him leaving though with PSG having a summer-long interest in the player who moved to Manchester for £70million back in 2021. Saudi Arabian clubs too have been touted as possible buyers but Chelsea also remain an interested party.

The Athletic reports that those at Old Trafford believe a late play from the Blues could be on the cards as they continue to throw money at their squad. Despite adding Pedro Neto and Joao Felix about to join the Chelsea bosses could still move for Sancho.
With a departure expected for the youngster, the MEN report that United would prefer to see him leave on a permanent deal as opposed to a loan.
The Tunisian has drawn interest from Burnley who are considering a transfer or loan with an obligation to buy after the 21-year-old joined United from Monaco for £9m in 2019.
While earlier reports suggest United would not be in the market for another full-back, Team Talk suggest Ten Hag has Ben Chilwell on his radar.
The Chelsea defender has already been deemed surplus to requirements at Stamford Bridge. Enzo Maresca told reporters that it would be better for last season's captain to move on.
Sport report that Juventus ace Federico Chiesa has received an offer to join United.

The winger has been deemed surplus to requirements in Turin and is expected to move having not been included for the team's opening match of the season. It could take just £13m to secure the deal it is said.
Chelsea have also been linked with the Italian with a deal that could see Raheem Sterling head to the Old Lady in the opposite direction.

The Danish midfielder has been offered to Ajax according to reports and United are looking for at least £5m for the former Spurs star. The Athletic claim that the Dutch side require sales to balance their books however.
Jadon Sancho would be open to leaving United to play regular football elsewhere, according to The Athletic.

The winger missed out on United's squad for the opening day win over Fulham after suffering with an ear issue but has been linked with moves away from the club. It has been said he could be used in a swap deal to PSG, while he has also been touted for an unlikely move to Chelsea..
Fulham are reportedly set to confirm a deal for Sander Berge today. The Burnley star is undergoing his medical ahead of completing a move and was one of United' back-up options.
Fabrizio Romano reports Facundo Pellistri's exit has now been agreed.
Panathinaikos and United have agreed a fee in excess £5m for the winger with a sell-on fee set to be included for the 22-year-old. Pellistri will leave Old Trafford after 25 first-team appearances.
Burnley are the latest suitors to show interest in signing Hannibal Mejbri this summer. The Clarets are said to be open to either a permanent deal or loan with an obligation to buy, per the Athletic.

The Athletic also report that United have decided against signing a left-back this summer, even with Luke Shaw's injury. The Red Devils were linked with a move for Fenerbahce’s Ferdi Kadioglu but are said to have decided they are content with being able to utilise Noussair Mazraoui and Diogo Dalot.

Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna has travelled to England to participate in face-to-face meetings, per the Athletic. McTominay is on the agenda with progress being made over a deal. They also report Fulham have moved on as McTominay waits for other offers. Galatasaray, Fenerbahce and Evertoon could also emerge as options.

Manchester Evening News report that the departure of Scott McTominay is required to facilitate a move for Ugarte in the next week or so. The Scotland international has been linked to Fulham and Napoli in recent days.
Gary Neville didn't sound entirely convinced as he made his argument but claimed that Manchester United's midfield could be the area they have more strength and depth than Liverpool.
With Ugarte seen as a priority, maybe he shouldn't make the claim just yet...
Full story.
United signing another forward has not been ruled out this month and there could yet be a shock move before the deadline. Dominic Calvert-Lewin could prove an opportunistic move.

Fabrizio Romano said: "In terms of a striker at the moment, Manchester United know that there are many opportunities on the market. Calvert-Lewin is out of contract in one year at Everton, so it could be an opportunity for many clubs.

"Ivan Toney wants to change, and he is another player who is out of contract in one year, so Manchester United are aware of these opportunities, but at the moment their focus is on different positions."
The Red Devils are apparently prepared to wait until deadline day to make their move for the Uruguay international, with PSG remaining steadfast in their £51m valuation for the moment.
United are 'prepared to bide their time' in the hope of strengthening their position, according to The Guardian.
Reports suggest that United are now looking to come to an agreement to sign Manuel Ugarte on loan from PSG, with an obligation to buy the midfielder. Jorge Mendes is said to be leading negotiations.

With new arrivals in the backline Victor Lindelof's may have dropped down the United pecking order. The Swede is only interested in departing the club if the correct move comes along however. Fiorentina have been linked so far but an exit may not yet be on the cards.
“Lindelof is not desperate to leave Manchester United," reports Fabrizio Romano. "It has to be for a big opportunity, big, big club.

“He was on the list of Atletico Madrid, Inter, and several others clubs [last year], and Man United never wanted to let him go, and Erik ten Hag always wanted to keep him in the squad. Now Lindelof, with one year left on his contract is not going to accept something that is not 100 per cent what he really wants, otherwise in January he can agree to sign with any club in the world.
“This is why Lindelof will take his time, not desperate to leave, unless there is a good opportunity at an important club. I don’t think 100 per cent Lindelof will leave Manchester United.”
We are back once again for another day of Manchester United transfers. Stick around and we'll keep you updated with all of the latest goings on!
That's all from us - we'll be back tomorrow with all the latest!
Brentford are keen to get Ivan Toney sorted by the weekend - and are likely to accept £45m for the striker, reports The Sun.
Man Utd are among those interest but Chelsea could yet be tempted into a late swoop for the England striker - despite them having major squad issues and needing to get players off their books.

headline: Scott McTominay holds key to Man Utd's two-player swoop as transfer talks revivedVIDEO
body: Scott McTominay's contract with Manchester United expires next summer, although the club have the option to extend the midfielder's deal a further 12 months

The sale of Scott McTominay could be critical if Manchester United hope to complete their midfield revamp before the close of the transfer window, with the Red Devils short on funds for both Sander Berge and Manual Ugarte

McTominay’s future has been uncertain throughout the summer, with interest arriving from Fulham and Napoli for the central midfielder. United rejected Fulham’s £20million offer earlier this summer, but the Daily Mail have reported that interest has been revived. Napoli, meanwhile, would prefer a loan-to-buy deal for the Scotland international
McTominay has just one year remaining on his contract with United, albeit the club has the option to extend it for a further 12 months.

A product of United’s academy, the 27-year-old has clocked over 250 appearances for the club since making his senior debut in April 2017. Last season saw him relish his best-ever goal return in the United shirt as he scored 10 times, including winning goals against Brentford, Chelsea and Aston Villa in the Premier League.
However, McTominay could make way to help fund manager Erik ten Hag’s ongoing squad revamp.

United are currently interested in Burnley ’s Berge and Paris Saint-Germain’s Ugarte. United’s initial offer for the Sheffield United defensive midfielder was short of the club’s £30million valuation, while Ugarte is reportedly the preferred choice but any move remains at the mercy of PSG ’s asking price.
Ugarte was not involved in the French club’s Ligue 1 season opener against Le Havre last Friday amid transfer speculation.
While PSG are reportedly happy to part ways with the midfielder, they are unwilling to budge from their £52million valuation, which is how much they paid Sporting to sign him in July last year.
United have unveiled their new adidas home kit with new front-of-shirt sponsors for the 2024/25 season - and you can get your hands on it right now.
Ugarte featured in 37 games for the French heavyweights last season as the club won Ligue 1 and the Coupe de France.
Berge has not featured in either of Burnley’s opening two fixtures in the Championship. New manager Scott Parker attributed the absence against Luton in the season opener to a squad injury.

Although Parker had hoped to get Berge back in time for the clash against Cardiff, it ultimately came too soon. Berge moved to the Clarets from Sheffield United last summer but was unable to halt the club's slide back down to the Championship.
